modules.description: Provides functions for manipulating and formatting OCaml source code, including parsing, pretty-printing, and transformation of abstract syntax trees. Works with OCaml's internal representation of code, such as lambda expressions and type information. Used to enhance code formatting capabilities in ocamlformat by extending standard library functions.

This module provides pretty-printing operations for structured text formatting, including box management, line break control, and indentation, using a `formatter` type to manage output layout. It works with text content, numeric types, and lists, enabling precise control over spacing, wrapping, and nesting for applications like code generation or readable output in tools. Specific use cases include generating formatted debug outputs, pretty-printing data structures, or aligning complex textual representations with customizable separators and box hierarchies.
